messages.author: timsteele
messages.text: At the very least, we should call this something like client_only_unencrypted_data

messages.author: Nicolas Zea
messages.text:
On 2013/07/09 20:09:00, timsteele wrote:
> At the very least, we should call this something like
> client_only_unencrypted_data

Done.

messages.author: timsteele
messages.text: Did you consider having a component (maybe part of GCP?) responsible for dealing with this legacy issue by keeping the unencrypted specifics in an in-memory "lookaside" buffer? It's awkward, but it's also awkward to have the need for a workaround at the glue layer travel all the way over the wire to the server...

messages.author: Nicolas Zea
messages.text:
On 2013/07/09 20:09:00, timsteele wrote:
> Did you consider having a component (maybe part of GCP?) responsible for dealing
> with this legacy issue by keeping the unencrypted specifics in an in-memory
> "lookaside" buffer? It's awkward, but it's also awkward to have the need for a
> workaround at the glue layer travel all the way over the wire to the server...

Discussed offline. Any approach that doesn't modify the EntitySpecifics breaks the API abstraction, which has serious drawbacks. Instead, I've opted to add some more CHECK's to be extra safe.
